title: Unable to log in at server.  etc.

Also when I try to send an email (new message) it comes up with Newgroup where the recipient email should be
creator: paul.dign

title: How do I get TB to work properly with juno.com?
content: I have used Juno for one of my email accounts since it was first introduced in the 1990s. More recently, I have learned to use Juno's POP and SMTP servers, however in recent years some issue developed between Juno and Mozilla/Thunderbird, wherein TB will not place a message sent through Juno in the Sent or Drafts folder (as applicable) on the Juno server(s), forcing TB to use separate local folders instead. For incoming mail, I use server pop.juno.com on port 995 with SSL/TLS security and encrypted-password authentication. For outgoing mail, I use server smtp.juno.com on port 465. Every time I send mail, the following messages appear: There is not enough disk space to download new messages. Try deleting old mail, emptying the Trash folder, and compacting your mail folders, and then try again. which is inaccurate, given I have a considerable-sized hard drive (500 GB), plus multiple USB drives with much more space... then comes: Your message was sent but a copy was not placed in your sent folder (Sent) due to network or file access errors. You can retry or save the message locally to Local Folders/Sent-bob.in.jersey@juno.com. with the choice of buttons Retry, Save, or Don't Save. Please do something about this, or tell me what I need to do to ensure that the messages go to where they're supposed to go. Thanks.
creator: Dale_Latimer

title: Inbox suddenly became a subfolder in trash - how to fix?
content: While I was checking emails on my POP3 gmail account I was sending some unwanted and older messages one by one to the trash folder after checking that they were indeed for trash, when suddenly the whole inbox moved to become a sub-folder in the trash folder. I tried simply moving the inbox folder back to where it should be but it will not move. I checked the inbox folder properties and the path is directing it to trash. I tried editing that path to delete the /trash element but I can not change that path. mailbox:///home/barbara/.thunderbird/jzlrnnn0.default-release/Mail/pop.gmail-2.com/Trash.sbd/Inbox See also screen shot attached I checked the mozilla/thunderbird help pages for any info about this problem and found nothing specifically addressing moving a folder from trash back to its rightful place. How do I fix this and get my inbox back to where it should be. As a sub-question, what happened and why, and how to stop that ever happening again?
creator: barbara_hodgkinson

title: Calendar "Attach" help needed
content:
Hi All,

Need help with linking a file to a calendar reminder (event).

In Outlook I used to be able to easily link a local file located in a specified folder on my computer. For eg: I would link a .pdf invoice for my electricity bill in a folder on my computer. I would create the event to remind me I had to pay this invoice and after creating the reminder link that PDF invoice to the event and when I clicked on it, it would open the invoice using Acrobat reader or whatever other PDF reader I assigned.

I tried to attach the link using the "website" attachment tab to the event in T'bird calendar and assigned Acrobat to open the file (invoice). Acrobat does open, but returns an error saying it can't find the .pdf file. The file is definitely in the nominated folder and the link to it is correct but file doesn't open. Anyone know what I'm doing wrong?

Any assistance much appreciated. Thank You

I noticed that Edit->Undo will undo moved messages and stuff, but not deleted messages. So if you send a message to the trash and hit undo, it won't undo that. Instead, it will undo whatever you did before it (or won't undo anything if you haven't done anything else since opening TB).

Or is that just me?

title: (MacOS Beta121.0b1) Thunderbird fails to start with a profile that has master password enabled. perhaps.

New profile → Load the problematic profile settings → Successful startup → Enable master password → Unable to start.
creator: P.F.FrontJr+firefox

title: Recipient field becomes huge and reduces writing area
content:
I have recently upgraded to 102, and am not planning to go to 115 for a long time.

A major issue for me with 102 is when composing/writing emails. Now that all my recipients addresses go into the one field, as soon as there are more than 2-3 addresses the To: (or CC or BCC) box expands downwards, pushing everything else down. I often write to up to 20 people at once, and the box becomes huge, the subject line is at the bottom of the screen, and there is only a small space showing where the message can be written.

In previous versions, a long list of recipients scrolled up and down, and therefore kept a static size, and everything else stayed in their places.

How can I stop the To: box becoming enormous?

Using a mailmerge addon is not an option. I do use groups of addresses (in the address book) for some things, but not always, and it is not appropriate for many emails. My preference would be to find some hidden option that allows the box to scroll on 1-2 lines.

I can use chromecss, if the code is provided for me to copy (I don't understand the syntax in general to write my own). I did have a working file going when I upgraded, so it may have something in it that is causing problems, but I am not savvy enough to find it.

I have looked quite thoroughly, and can't find anyone else who has mentioned this as a problem. I find it the most annoying issue in the upgrade for me.
creator: pandf

title: Full stop being inserted when not required
content: After a recent Thunderbird update (I'm now on v115) it now appears to be inserting a full stop (or period in US terminology) automatically after some text if you happen to accidentally, or deliberately, tap the space bar twice, giving a double space. Is there any setting to turn this off? I find this most annoying and it seems to be something my phone does too, so I guess it's come from that, as people are getting lazy and instead of typing the full stop at the end of a sentence, they simply tap the space bar twice and it adds the full stop for them. However, I don't like it on my phone, and I don't want this action in Thunderbird. I want my text exactly as I type it, not how someone else things I want it. Yes, I'm old fashioned and want my English exactly as I was taught, not this latest 'text' speak short hand stuff. So is there a setting somewhere, where I can turn this feature off. Thank you.

title: Disabling Threading FOREVER. and related shortcuts
content:
Threading is something I, and indeed large numbers of Thunderbird users, do NOT want, ever.

Please provide an option to disable threading, across all folders, all acounts.

Even worse, the option to Ignore Thread, is simply a way to lose emails. To have a shortcut to hide a message, without even knowing, is crazy. Given how poor Windows control of focus is, and how easy it is to start typing but actually still be in the email listings, its inevitable that you will hit e.g. K or A or whatever, and cause bizarre effects or lose emails.

So I want to disable threading to avoid losing emails. I would also like to disable Archiving, and other functions, that are all simply ways to lose emails by accident.

Thanks.

title: Automate configuration options deployment
content:
Hello I'm currently in need of configuring all of the clients with the Root CA certificate needed to use our new proxy server. I've seen that Thunderbird uses its own certificate repository, but there is yet a configuration option for reading Windows machine's own store, called security.enterprise_roots.enabled . This could be the best option since my users work on shared windows terminal servers. Is there a way to deploy this setting to all users? (I haven't found a GPO template for Thunderbird with this setting) I think I could create a logon script to copy a default user.js to every profile folder, but I don't know where the system could read the profiles path (multiple for most of the users).

thanks
creator: d.calzolato

title: Thunderbird work speed and marking msgs as read function degraded after major upgrade few weeks ago
content: Dear all, I am Thunderbird user for almost a few decades now. Since upgrade several weeks ago, my Thunderbird became slower, and, also started to work not as before. Now it is, after few minor updates up today, 115.5.0 (32-bit) version. The main issue, beside slower speed in showing messages, is it does not mark some messages as read when selected. When I scroll selecting unread messages to read/show them, some of them are marked read as before it did, but some of them stay unmarked in spite of multiple times selecting them and holding them selected. This happens regardless of setting “Automatically mark message as read” options Immediately on display, or After displaying for 1 second. In most cases it happens with last received unread message. Last time I remember such erratic behavior was decades ago. I tried to switch off and back on that option, then restarting program, but nothing changes in it’s behavior. Please advise. Thanks in advance, Zoran
creator: zoran.milojkovic

title: after downloading mails inbox of thunderbird does not synchronize with IMAP account
content:
Hi, I use Firefox since more than a decade and till aprox. 4 weeks it worked perfectly. Since then the following happens:

These are my settings

  • I have thunderbird on my local laptop
  • have outlook on my mobile phone
  • I use gmx-mail

I did not change anything reg. Settings on my mobile, in GMX or in thunderbird

I can download all my mails. In my local inbox on my computer, I delet mails. IN THE PAST: after deleting mails in my local inbox, they were also deleted in GMX and on my mobile SINCE aprox. 4 weeks: on my local laptop, mails are deleted (or moved to a local folder) - in GMX and on my mobile phone with outlook, the mails stay in the inbox.

It seems that the inbox is only synchronised with showing new mails from the server, but not with deleting or moving mails.

In this way it is impossible to organize myselfe since the inbox on my phone / in GMX is overflowing.

Thanks for your help, Oliver

title: Mozilla Thunderbird and Charter
content:
I have been using Thunderbird for a few years now to manage my charter domain email account. On October 9th, 2023 Thunderbird stopped updating with new emails and the application started throwing an error stating "Cannot connect to SMTP server".

I have spent countless hours on the phone with Charter who have been very helpful in tracing emails for my account (both outbound and inbound) using their web email application. However, when testing with Thunderbird - everything goes wrong again.

My current server configuration is as follows: Server Type: IMAP Mail Server Server Name: mobile.charter.net Port: 993 User Name: full_email_address@charter.net

Outgoing Server (SMTP) Configuration: Server Name: mobile.charter.net Port: 587 Connection Security: SSL/TLS Authentication: Normal Password Username: full_email_address@charter.net

As it stands, I can send emails from my Thunderbird account to my various Gmail accounts that I have created while trouble shooting. My inbox has not updated since October 9th, 2023 in Thunderbird, but there are active emails coming into my account when I check my Charter web email inbox.

In addition to that, I have disabled all AV rules around email services. When I try sending emails in Safe Mode (Windows 11), I cannot send emails.

I have tried the following links of similar questions below, nothing has resolved the issue: "Thunderbird is not working with Charter" - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1159943 "Cannot send email via Thunderbird" - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1242053 "Server timeout connection" - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1073157
creator: thirdclassemailacc

title: App Thunderbird para Android e IOS - Sugestão para Criação do App Thunderbird para Android e IOS
content:
App Thunderbird para Android e IOS - Sugestão para Criação do App Thunderbird para Android e IOS

Gostaria de deixar minha Sugestão para a Empresa Thunderbird Mozzilla, Criar um App disponível para Android e IOS pois milhões de clientes no mundo precisam acessar seus emails de forma gratuita mais não tem um aplicativo confiável.

Deixei essa mesmo sugestão para Empresa Americana número 1 em Soluções de Hospedagem no Mundo, eles pediram para deixar essa Sugestão com a Empresa Thunderbird Mozzilla criar um Aplicativo do seu Cliente de Email gratuito, para Android e IOS.

Aguardo retorno

title: I need help and I have questions about Thunderbird and others things too
content: Hello I need help and I have questions about Thunderbird and other things too. And they said I must sign for yahoo plus and after the 14-day trail I would be charged. in order to forward the income sbcglobal.net emails to spectrum. I don't understand Imap or know anything about Thunderbird, Can I use Thunderbird to setup Imap to atomically forward. my bcglobal.net email into spectrum.net account? If so, how do I do this? And what information do I need to have before setting this up? I know I need the server settings do I need both server settings for sbcglobal.net and spectrum.net and what Thunderbird, sever and can Thunderbird, setting muilpe emails at time I have 2 Gmail accounts I might wanted to use the imap to atomically forward. to spectrum.net one day? But right now, I am focus on atomically forward. my bcglobal.net email into spectrum.net account? using imap but I need help and know what I doing or what I need to do? can you help me? And do I have used Thunderbird, after this or can use specturm.net has my default email? Please email me at funstamper74@gmail.com Thank you Linda

title: Layout its different after new installation
